titleStmt.title: Thomas H. Gibbs et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2273

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlett.
Govenor of The State of Kentucky

We the undersigned Citizens of Russellville Logan County Ky would represent to your excellency that there is a Vacancy in the office of Justice of the Peace in The Russellville district caused by the removal of Geo. W. Herr. We would respectfully ask you to appoint James. H. Beall of said district to fill said Vacancy. Russellville Ky. Novr 16th 1865.

Jas. E. Wright Clerk Logan Co Court
County Judge

Thos H Grubbs
J H Buster
J F Buster
E. C. Malone
James H. Mosby
A. M. Reynolds
L A Harper
T, P,, Dance
R G Higgins

J,, E,, Dance
Geo. T. Edwards.
D,, B,, Penny
G. W. Welles
L. M. Mast
All residents of the town of Russellville
The appointment of James H. Beall who is recommended in the petition will give satisfaction if made.

Nov. 16th 1865
A, D, Kennedy
Presiding Judge of the Logan County Court
